item.title: Drainage blocked by house causing dangerous driving, 10th January
item.description:
The drainage that should flow from the house under the road is blocked causing this to flow onto the road. This is freezing and becoming extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A speed indication sign that you installed a year ago or more still isn't working. Nor is the equivalent sign the other side of the road. Traffic regularly exceeds the speed limit here at extreme risk to pedestrians on the narrow pavement. Please bring these signs into use., 10th January
item.description:
Marked on map and you only have two of these signs on Church Road, Cheltenham.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Dead tree in ready to fall, 10th January
item.description:
I couldn't find the appropriate heading to cover this. Sorry. On this footpath which joins Laxton Road and Green Lane there is a tree which appears to be dead and is at risk of falling across the footpath. The trunk is approx 5 inches in diameter. I guess that the footpath needs looking at with an experienced eye as there are possible other difficulties of this nature.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Horsbere Brook bank collapsing, 10th January
item.description:

item.title: Burst Water Main, 10th January
item.description:
Opposite Tansi house 65 Gretton Road The sign on the pavement suggests that Severn Trent are aware but due to the freezing conditions this is an accident waiting to happen. Urgent request to cone off the area as a precaution. Freezing conditions tonight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Gretton Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Pedestrian crossing phase glitches, 10th January
item.description:
Sometimes, the traffic lights at the triangle junction between Gloucester Road and Lansdown Road "forget" that the button has been pressed to request a pedestrian phase. I.e. the "wait" indicator lights after the button is pressed, but then turns off without a pedestrian phase happening. Pressing it again usually leads to a subsequent pedestrian phase as usual in the cycle. Please could you look at this? Specifically this is on the North side of the A40, on the east-west crossing across B4633 Gloucester Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working
